bdy.p:
Unconventional Action is an anarchist and anti-authoritarian organization formed in the
United States
with the purposes of engaging in direct action in opposition to the 2008 Democratic and
Republican National Conventions."The pinstripe brigade lines up to defend convention scofflaws", Minneapolis Star-Tribune (Aug 30, 2007). It was structured as an emerging network. Police documents alleging to be based on informants' information claimed that the organization hosted with the RNC Welcoming Committee an "action camp" from July 31-Aug. 3, 2008, at
Lake Geneva in
Minnesota
, which was attended by approximately 50 individuals. According to one of the informants, a raised platform stage labeled "Xcel Center" was the primary target of the training.
Associated Press
(September 3, 2008). " Search warrant filing details anarchists’ RNC disruption plans",
Boston Herald . Ahead of the Democratic National Convention in Denver,
Colorado
, Unconventional Action members had their cars searched by police near their convention centre.LeTendre, Linda (August 29, 2008). " Beijing and Denver: Separated at birth?". Waking Peace. Daily Gazette. In Denver, Unconventional Action manifested itself under the umbrella group Recreate68 as Unconventional Denver, "a local coordinating group for a national network of anarchists that [was] planning to disrupt the convention", in the words of the New American.Jasper, William F. (September 1, 2008). " Recreating Riots", New American. Retrieved on 2008-09-24.

Ben Yager, who helped lead Unconventional Denver, asserted that its goal was to blockade the delegates to the Democratic National Convention, thereby preventing them from getting to their hotels.Montero, David (February 21, 2008). " City maps plan for protest permits",
Rocky Mountain News . Retrieved on 2008-09-24.

We’re going to physically stand in the way of what’s going to happen … The anarchists who are interested in confronting the Democratic National Convention are interested in doing more than just marching … We’re interested in disrupting the spectacle of the DNC. —Tim Simons, Unconventional Denver organizer

Unconventional Action were supported by
CrimethInc. groups, who distributed the organizations plans ahead of the conventions.ret marut. " CrimethInc. Groups Endorse RNC Strategy". CrimethInc. Far East Blog.
CrimethInc. . Retrieved on 2008-09-24.
